extends ImageView

      private class  TouchImageView.CompatScroller 
      private class  TouchImageView.DoubleTapZoom
      DoubleTapZoom calls a series of runnables which apply an animated zoom in/out graphic to the image.
      private class  TouchImageView.Fling
      Fling launches sequential runnables which apply the fling graphic to the image.
      private class  TouchImageView.GestureListener
      Gesture Listener detects a single click or long click and passes that on to the view's listener.
      static interface  TouchImageView.OnTouchImageViewListener

      Responsible for all touch events.
      private class  TouchImageView.ScaleListener
      ScaleListener detects user two finger scaling and scales image.

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered by default.
        Parameters:
        scale -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale,
                    float focusX,
                    float focusY)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered around the point (focusX, focusY). These floats range from 0 to 1 and denote the focus point as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        scale -
        focusX -
        focusY -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float scale,
                    float focusX,
                    float focusY,
                    ScaleType scaleType)
        Set zoom to the specified scale. Image will be centered around the point (focusX, focusY). These floats range from 0 to 1 and denote the focus point as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Parameters:
        scale -
        focusX -
        focusY -
        scaleType -

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(TouchImageView img)
        Set zoom parameters equal to another TouchImageView. Including scale, position, and ScaleType.
        Parameters:
        img -

      • getScrollPosition

        public PointF getScrollPosition()
        Return the point at the center of the zoomed image. The PointF coordinates range in value between 0 and 1 and the focus point is denoted as a fraction from the left and top of the view. For example, the top left corner of the image would be (0, 0). And the bottom right corner would be (1, 1).
        Returns:
        PointF representing the scroll position of the zoomed image.

      • setScrollPosition

        public void setScrollPosition(float focusX,
                              float focusY)
        Set the focus point of the zoomed image. The focus points are denoted as a fraction from the left and top of the view. The focus points can range in value between 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        focusX -
        focusY -

      • fixTrans

        private void fixTrans()
        Performs boundary checking and fixes the image matrix if it is out of bounds.

      • fixScaleTrans

        private void fixScaleTrans()
        When transitioning from zooming from focus to zoom from center (or vice versa) the image can become unaligned within the view. This is apparent when zooming quickly. When the content size is less than the view size, the content will often be centered incorrectly within the view. fixScaleTrans first calls fixTrans() and then makes sure the image is centered correctly within the view.

      • getFixTrans

        private float getFixTrans(float trans,
                          float viewSize,
                          float contentSize)

        private float getFixDragTrans(float delta,
                              float viewSize,

      • getImageHeight

        private float getImageHeight()

      • onMeasure

        protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec,
                         int heightMeasureSpec)

      • fitImageToView

        private void fitImageToView()
        If the normalizedScale is equal to 1, then the image is made to fit the screen. Otherwise, it is made to fit the screen according to the dimensions of the previous image matrix. This allows the image to maintain its zoom after rotation.

      • setViewSize

        private int setViewSize(int mode,
                        int size,
                        int drawableWidth)
        Set view dimensions based on layout params
        Parameters:
        mode -
        size -
        drawableWidth -
        Returns:

      • translateMatrixAfterRotate

        private void translateMatrixAfterRotate(int axis,
                                        float trans,
                                        float prevImageSize,
                                        float imageSize,
                                        int prevViewSize,
                                        int viewSize,
                                        int drawableSize)
        After rotating, the matrix needs to be translated. This function finds the area of image which was previously centered and adjusts translations so that is again the center, post-rotation.
        Parameters:
        axis - Matrix.MTRANS_X or Matrix.MTRANS_Y
        trans - the value of trans in that axis before the rotation
        prevImageSize - the width/height of the image before the rotation
        imageSize - width/height of the image after rotation
        prevViewSize - width/height of view before rotation
        viewSize - width/height of view after rotation
        drawableSize - width/height of drawable

      • setState

        private void setState(TouchImageView.State state)

                        float focusX,

                        boolean stretchImageToSuper)

      • transformCoordTouchToBitmap

        private PointF transformCoordTouchToBitmap(float x,
                                           float y,
                                           boolean clipToBitmap)
        This function will transform the coordinates in the touch event to the coordinate system of the drawable that the imageview contain
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of touch event
        y - y-coordinate of touch event
        clipToBitmap - Touch event may occur within view, but outside image content. True, to clip return value to the bounds of the bitmap size.
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the point touched, in the coordinate system of the original drawable.

      • transformCoordBitmapToTouch

        private PointF transformCoordBitmapToTouch(float bx,
                                           float by)
        Inverse of transformCoordTouchToBitmap. This function will transform the coordinates in the drawable's coordinate system to the view's coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        bx - x-coordinate in original bitmap coordinate system
        by - y-coordinate in original bitmap coordinate system
        Returns:
        Coordinates of the point in the view's coordinate system.
